oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Governor Prentice Cooper to Mrs. John M. Donnelly, 1940 December 12
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A typed letter, signed, dated 12 December 1940, from Tennessee Governor Prentice Cooper, to Mrs. John M. Donnelly, the Christmas Carol Publicity Chairman of the Fannie Battle Day Home Social Workers in 1940. In the letter, Governor Cooper commends the organization for their social work and community service. The Tennessee Executive Chamber stationery with its gold-embossed seal includes an image of a plow, a sheaf of wheat, and a cotton plant under the Roman numerals XVI, representing Tennessee as the 16th state to enter the Union. The word "Agriculture" is on the center of the seal and the lower half displays a boat and boatman, with the word "Commerce" and "1796," the year of statehood. Forms part of the Fannie Battle Day Home Records. 1 letter : col. ; 8 x 10.5 in.
